experience: You and David both know Adwait Ullal, Jeremy Roberts, and 2 others
Modern Healthcare Looks to Castlight on the Future of Transparency

Castlight makes it as easy as humanly possible to navigate healthcare and live happier, healthier, more productive lives.Our health navigation platform connects with hundreds of health vendors, benefits resources, and plan designs, giving rise to the world’s first comprehensive app for all health needs. We guide individuals—based on their unique profile—to the best resources available to them, whether they are healthy, chronically ill, or actively seeking medical care. In doing so, we help companies regain control over rising healthcare costs and get more value from their benefits investments. Castlight revolutionized the healthcare sector with the introduction of data-driven price transparency tools in 2008 and the first consumer-grade wellbeing platform in 2012. Today, Castlight serves as the health navigation platform for millions of people and is a trusted partner to many of the largest employers in the world. We are headquartered in San Francisco, and can be found online at www.castlighthealth.com and on the New York Stock Exchange as CSLT.And of course, our values: One team on a mission making things happen!Explore our job opportunities! http://bit.ly/JobsatCastlight

Senior member of talent acquisition team managing end-to-end recruiting process and talent attraction & retention for global technical positions with a primary focus on US R&D roles for a leading enterprise software provider for Cloud Service Management and Unified Endpoint Management solutions. •	Successfully lead recruiting process for key roles which drive the company R&D strategy forward for future development projects, as well as replace attrition, all involving skill-sets that are both highly technical and exceedingly rare, within an extremely competitive environment.•	Lower costs by nearly eliminating agency usage for technical roles by sourcing invaluable talent.•	Develop tools to help overall recruiting team, including our competitive recruiting Battle Card, as well as assessing outside tools and services to best support talent acquisition and keep cost-savings in mind.•	Develop and deliver L&D training program to all HEAT Software people managers globally over several sessions focused on New Hire Retention, providing our people managers tools needed to hire, build, develop and retain successful teams, and reduce the significant costs associated with unexpected attrition.
Sr. HR Business Partner & Strategic HR Manager - HP Enterprise Security Products

Actively partner with, coach, and influence members of the executive global leadership team of the $700M Enterprise Security Products business unit within HP Software, including team leaders across: R&D, Support, Professional Services, Product Marketing, Sales, and Strategy & Operations.•	Worked as a trusted advisor to general managers and leaders within network security (TippingPoint), applications security (Fortify), log and event management (ArcSight), payments security (Atalla), product marketing, product support, and services to help define and implement strategic personnel initiatives to align to business goals.•	Worked closely with internal partners to redesign the hiring requisition process, promoting transparent and effective resource management aligned to business affordability and growth priorities.•	Helped to develop and implement labor strategy around location optimization, including building and developing low-cost hubs for future growth, and to ensure the business could maximize efficiencies across locations and job functions.•	Helped implement comprehensive labor strategy around attraction and retention of talent, including hiring and detailed career development planning, fostering high-potential talent, and internal succession plans for key roles.•	Advised on organizational design and structure for building new, and reforming existing, organizations within R&D and Support.•	Drove global initiatives involving recruiting, partnering with recruiting teams in key regions in Europe, Asia and the US, to quickly scale to hiring ramps, and to attract key talent based on business priorities.•	Developed Sales Advisory Council to act as an internal advisory board to improve the sales organization, and to provide development opportunities for high potential sales leaders.•	Advised during M&A and business strategy discussion on personnel and process matters.

Led recruiting team responsible for all Engineering, R&D and Product Management positions within the US for HP Software, a $4B+ business unit within HP consisting of software business groups centered around Security, Cloud, Big Data and Automation, forming a 12,000 person global organization.•	Managed and built a team of full-cycle and contract recruiters and strategic sourcing leads distributed across the US, with a focus and responsibility on fulfilling the hiring needs for all US technical software positions within HP Software.•	Management philosophy built around transparency of expectations, accountability for metrics, and a team focus on direct contributions to business needs that resulted in a highly motivated and successful team.•	Acted as a consultative advisor and influencer to several software business leaders, specifically around hiring, team organization and workforce planning, interviewing, and retention.•	Developed and implemented a successful strategy for recruitment within a highly competitive talent marketplace, which in addition to a standard approach also included unique initiatives across social media, directed disruptive recruiting campaigns, and targeted in-person recruiting events showcasing unique competitive advantages of HP Software, resulting in hundreds of hires per annum.•	Partnered closely with software business leadership of some of the fastest growing critical business units within HP, including Security (ArcSight, TippingPoint, Fortify), Big Data (Vertica, Autonomy), Cloud (HP Converged Cloud, Cloud Automation) to deliver talent across the board.•	Worked closely with recruiting and HR leadership to build teams better focused around business needs and growth projections, rather than a one-size-fits-all model.•	Helped to redefine relationship between full-cycle recruiters and strategic sourcing organization, building a partnership model within the team that allowed for improved delivery of results.
